column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=Ultrasensitive Detection of Prions by saPMCA
#Text=[0161] Sensitivity of detection after automated PMCA was analyzed by comparing the signal intensity in Western blots before and after amplification.
#Text=It was determined that 140 PMCA cycles enabled detection of PrP.sup.Sc in as little as a 6.6 million-fold dilution of 263K scrapie brain.

#Text=An equivalent quantity of PrP.sup.Sc was detected without PMCA in a 1,000-fold dilution of the same material, indicating that the increase of sensitivity under these conditions was approximately 6,600-fold.
#Text=[0162] During these studies, it was noted that the efficiency of amplification started to decrease after around 150 cycles (75 h of incubation).
#Text=The inventors discovered that the reason for this problem is the inactivation of the material by continuous incubation at 37.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=It is likely that incubation may have a negative effect on the stability of PrP.sup.C substrate or other brain cofactors essential to catalyze the conversion.

#Text=This conclusion was based on an experiment in which the amplification efficiency was dramatically reduced when the 10% normal brain homogenate was pre-incubated (with our without sonication) during 72 h prior to the beginning of PMCA amplifications.
#Text=This result was motivation to develop a new technology called serial automated PMCA (saPMCA) in order to further increase sensitivity of detection.
#Text=This technology consists of performing a series of up to 144 PMCA cycles each.

#Text=After the end of a first round of 144 PMCA cycles, samples are diluted 10-fold into fresh 10% normal brain homogenate and another 144 (or less) PMCA cycles is performed. saPMCA resolves the problem of exhaustion of the substrate and enables to maintain the exponential conversion of PrP.
#Text=Two successive rounds of PMCA cycling separated by a 10-fold dilution of the amplified samples into fresh 10% normal brain homogenate, led to a dramatic increase in sensitivity.
#Text=The experiment consisted of performing a first round of 96 PMCA cycles in which PrP.sup.Sc signal was detected up to the 3.1.times.10.sup.6-fold dilution of scrapie brain.
#Text=Thereafter, this and all the successive dilutions in which no PrP.sup.Sc signal was detected were diluted 10-fold into normal brain homogenate and subjected to a new round of 118 PMCA cycles.
#Text=This second round of PMCA enabled detection of PrP.sup.Sc up to the 5.times.10.sup.10-fold dilution of scrapie-infected hamster brain.
#Text=By comparing the signal intensity of PrP.sup.Sc with or without PMCA, the increase of sensitivity was around 10-million fold.
#Text=This sensitivity can be further increased by performing more rounds of saPMCA.
#Text=Example 5
#Text=Infinite Prion Replication In Vitro by saPMCA
